title: Is it true that there are no individual consciousnesses, but rather, the same consciousness that 'individuals' all tap into? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve heard this concept from a Harvard PhD. He talked to me about the “pool of consciousness” model - where the energy of a lifetime drifts off to some place where there’s a pool of consciousness, and when people remember previous lifetimes,they’re merely tapping into “someone else’s journey.” As I said to him “I’d agree with you but then we’d both be wrong.” That’s not what’s in the research. What people under deep hypnosis (and by extension, often report during a near death event) is that we have individual “portions” of consciousness. They claim that we “only bring about a third” of that energy to a particular lifetime, and roughly two thirds of that energy is “always back home” in the between lives realm. When someone does a between life hypnotherapy sessions (as taught by the Newton Institute to its licensed therapists) a person experiences going back “home” and reconnecting with that higher consciousness (for lack of a better term) and while being connected to that higher consciousness we are able to “remember all of our lifetimes.” As in “our” lifetimes - not everyone else’s. However, because we are “all connected” when we are back there, those that are closest to us - the members of our soul group - we can access their previous lifetimes, or they can “show them to us.” Further, that while the two thirds of our energy is “back home” we can and do observe everything that’s occurring here with our lifetime, and we are available (to ourselves) for advice, guidance, etc. I’ve been filming people doing these sessions for a decade, and if they reported something else I’d report that. But in the 45 I’ve filmed,they mirror the 7000 that Michael Newton reported in his books, or the 2000 that Dr. Helen Wambach reported in her books. They say basically the same things about our journey. But don’t take my word for it - anyone can access this information. I recommend taking a look at Newton’s books, and their website where they have a database of practitioners. Some are better at it than others, but like I say, I’ve been filming these events for a decade now and get the same results no matter who the person is doing the questioning, or who the person is providing answers. Doesn’t matter their background, religion or gender - I’ve chosen most of the candidates because of their skepticism (or strong belief in an alternative system) and they all have the same results (roughly.) There are reports that we “all feel connected back home” which may be the source of the “one consciousness concept” - but they report that we “return to our soul group” where we have (Newton reported from 3–25) individuals that we normally reincarnate with, people we’ve known for a long time (hence the characteristics that are similar to quantum entanglement) and continue to reconnect with. They are separate souls (only bringing about a third of their energy here at any time) but we recognize them when we get “back home.”

The individual consciousness and the collective consciousness both exist simultaneously. Everything is consciousness. Everything is made from consciousness. Nothing can exist outside of consciousness. Consciousness is the one and only source to everything. Think of oneness (consciousness) coming into more and more distinctness for the illusionary individualistic experience. The I (Michelle) is perceiving life through a personal and unique perspective. Only Michelle knows what life is like as Michelle. That is my individual consciousness. When Michelle opens her eyes in the morning she is tapping into the collective consciousness of her family, of Rome, of Italy, of Earth and of the universe. Her internal consciousness and awareness either gels, questions, wrestles, denies, accepts or fears the outside world consciousness. Thoughts are like ticker tapes that endlessly pass through our minds. We each have our own ‘Icloud’ of thoughts which is our individual consciousness. Every thought that we have is not us thinking but consciousness simulating the thought. Each one of us are experiencing a collection of simulated thoughts. Michelle has her ‘Icloud’. Her ‘Icloud’ is designed by consciousness for Michelle’s distinct experience. Michelle is her ‘Icloud’. This is true from the micro to the macro. Every cell in Michelle’s body is conscious and is having its own unique conscious experience. Every cell in Michelle’s body has its own ‘Icloud’ of simulated thought that comes from consciousness. Earth as a planet is also conscious and has its own ‘Icloud’ of thoughts and experiences designed by consciousness. We are all one massive matrix of consciousness having infinite experiences of itself. We are all infinite expressions of consciousness. Consciousness is God and God is consciousness.
